basic_data.Description: 1. AWARD PURPOSE:THE PEST DETECTION/EMERGENCY PROJECTS (PD/EP) BRANCH IS RESPONSIBLE FORTHE EARLY DETECTION AND PROMPT ERADICATION OF INJURIOUS AGRICULTURALPESTS BY CONDUCTING A STATEWIDE TRAPPING PROGRAM FOR EXOTIC INSECT PESTSBY IMPLEMENTING SPECIAL SURVEYS FOR NEWLY EMERGING PESTS THAT ARESIGNIFICANT AGRICULTURAL PESTS AND PLANT DISEASES FOR WHICH TRAPS ARENOT AVAILABLE AND PROVIDING EMERGENCY ERADICATION SERVICES USING THEBEST AVAILABLE SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY. THIS WORK PLAN ENSURES THEDEVELOPMENT, RAPID RESPONSE, AND MAINTENANCE OF THE EMERGENCY PLANTHEALTH RESPONSE TEAMS (EPHRT) THROUGHOUT THE STATE THAT SERVE AS THEFIRST RESPONDERS TO PLANT PEST EMERGENCY ERADICATION PROJECTS.COMPONENTS INCLUDE CREATING NEW PEST RESPONSE GUIDELINES, TRAINING,INITIAL RESPONSE SURVEY, TREATMENT, IF NEEDED, AND POTENTIALLY THEENFORCEMENT OF QUARANTINE REGULATIONS AND IDENTIFICATION OF EXOTIC PESTSIN CALIFORNIA IN COOPERATION WITH USDA-APHIS.2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:DEVELOP, PROMOTE, AND IMPLEMENT NEW CONTROL TECHNOLOGIES, AND TOOLS ANDTREATMENTS FOR USE IN PLANT HEALTH EMERGENCIES AND/OR ESTABLISHED PESTPROGRAMS. ENHANCE PREPARATION FOR PLANT PEST EMERGENCIES BY IMPROVINGTHE KNOWLEDGE BASE, RESPONSE OPTIONS AND CAPABILITIES PRIOR TO THE ONSETOF A PLANT HEALTH EMERGENCY. PROVIDE INITIAL AND SHORT-TERM FUNDING TOQUICKLY IMPLEMENT PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT THE STATE THAT EMPLOY EXISTING ANDINITIAL RESPONSE PROTOCOLS FOR THE OVERARCHING GOALS OF CONTAINMENT,CONTROL, OR ERADICATION IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING THE DEVELOPMENT OF A PLANTHEALTH EMERGENCY. PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PRIOR TO, DURING, ANDIMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING THE DEVELOPMENT OF A PLANT HEALTH EMERGENCYTHROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW PEST RESPONSE GUIDELINES (NRPG) FOR THEPOTENTIAL INTRODUCTION OF EXOTIC PLANT PESTS.3. DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:EVALUATION OF THE THOROUGHNESS OF EPHRT CAN BE QUANTIFIED BY THE NUMBEROF EMERGENCY RESPONSES AND THE NUMBER OF PROJECTS WHERE THE PEST ISDECLARED ERADICATED. A TABULATION OF THE NUMBER OF DELIMITATION SURVEYSAND THE SIZE OF THE RESULTANT ERADICATION PROJECT CAN ALSO BE USED TODETERMINE IF THE EPHRT EFFORTS WERE SUFFICIENT. THE SUCCESS OF THEERADICATION PROGRAM IS MONITORED BY INTENSIVE SURVEY LEVELS FOR ASPECIFIED TIME PERIOD AFTER THE LAST PEST HAS BEEN DETECTED. TYPICALLY,THIS TIME PERIOD IS DETERMINED BY A TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENT DEVELOPMENTALMODEL DRIVE BY DAY DEGREES. NEGATIVE SURVEY RESULTS WOULD INDICATE THATTHE PREVIOUS ERADICATIVE ACTIONS HAVE BEN AND CONTINUE TO BE EFFECTIVE.4. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES):RAPID RESPONSE IS CRITICAL TO PROVIDE FOR AND HELP DEVELOP SMALL, QUICK,AND EFFECTIVE MITIGATION OPTIONS THAT WILL REDUCE DISPROPORTIONALIMPACTS TO SMALL GROWERS, RELEASING THEM FROM NEW PEST QUARANTINESQUICKER AND ALLOWING THEM TO GET BACK INTO PRODUCTION. THIS APPROACHALSO MINIMIZES THE IMPACT ON THE PUBLIC AND THE ENVIRONMENT BY AVOIDINGLARGE-SCALE TREATMENT PROGRAMS INVOLVING THE APPLICATION OF PESTICIDES.WITHOUT A RAPID RESPONSE, THE NEW PESTS COULD CAUSE DEVASTATING LOSSESTO THE AGRICULTURAL INDUSTRY IF THEY WERE TO BECOME ESTABLISHED INCALIFORNIA, AND SEVERELY IMPACT EXPORT AND TRADE.5. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES, IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT THE TIME OF AWARD:CONTRACTS WITH COUNTY AGRICULTURAL COMMISSIONERS (CAC), CALIFORNIAOFFICE OF ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH HAZARD ASSESSMENT (OEHHA), CALIFORNIADEPARTMENT OF PESTICIDE REGULATION (DPR), UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA DAVIS(UCD), CALIFORNIA CONSERVATION CORPS (CCC), AND COOPERATIVE AGRICULTURALSUPPORT SERVICES (CASS) WILL BE USED TO CARRY OUT SURVEY TASKS,EVALUATION, AND OTHER SUPPORT SERVICES.
basic_data.Awarding Sub Agency: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service
